intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum subsp. pallens, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow-orange central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and woodland edges. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
